result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Geraty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy J Geraty is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy J Geraty was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid FORTHWITH - In lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 7 days in the Waukesha County Jail, CONSECUTIVE to the 60 days, but CONCURRENT to he present sentence.  Court waives DNA surcharge.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: Waukesha County Case 09CF1240.
